description: From atavism +‎ -istic, from French atavisme, from Latin atavus (“ancestor”), from at + avus (“grandfather”).

adjectives.description: atavistic (comparative more atavistic, superlative most atavistic)

entries.meaning: (biology) Of the recurrence of a trait reappearing after an absence of one or more generations due to a chance recombination of genes.
examples: Although the heterozygote gives it an atavistic appearance, the gene is not atavistic.

entries.meaning: Of a throwback or exhibiting primitivism.
examples: Because I am atavistic enough to believe that drawing is the basic language of the illustrator, even as words comprise the basic language of the writer…

entries.meaning: Relating to earlier, more primitive behavior that returns after an absence.
